feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Avalanche Warning issued February 08 at 4:24PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Valdez Avalanche Center. ...THE VALDEZ AVALANCHE CENTER HAS ISSUED AN AVALANCHE WARNING... * WHATAvalanche warning. The avalanche danger is high. Very dangerous avalanche conditions exist. * WHEREFor the mountains in and around Valdez and Thompson Pass

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 08 at 2:28PM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 9 inches. Winds gusts up to 40 mph. * WHERE...Klondike Highway above 2000 feet. * WHEN...Until noon AKST Wednesday.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued February 08 at 2:15PM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Ward Lake near Ketchikan. * WHEN...Until 900 AM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...

entry.title: Wind Chill Warning issued February 08 at 2:00PM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills to 70 below occuring. The dangerously cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Northeastern Brooks Range Passes.

entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills 60 to 70 below expected. * WHERE...Central Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...4 PM this afternoon to 6 PM Wednesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...East winds will also result in areas of blowing and drifting snow and reduced visibility to near a half

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 08 at 1:58PM AKST until February 08 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility to one half mile or less occurring. * WHERE...Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills. * WHEN...Until 9 PM today.

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 08 at 1:58PM AKST until February 09 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills 40 below zero to 50 below zero occurring. * WHERE...St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast. * WHEN...Now to midnight Wednesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The cold wind chills will cause frostbite
entry.cap:areaDesc: St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 08 at 1:58PM AKST until February 09 at 7:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow with low visibility and wind chills to 50 below zero occuring. Visibility will be on half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Chukchi Sea Coast.

entry.title: Wind Chill Warning issued February 08 at 1:55PM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills to 65 below occuring, and blowing snow with reduced visibility to one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Near Passes of the Southeastern Brooks Range.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 08 at 1:55PM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Cold wind chills to 40 below zero occurring, with blowing snow to one half mile or less at times. Plan on difficult travel conditions. * WHERE...Dalton Highway Summits and near Indian Mountain.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 08 at 1:55PM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow and cold wind chills as low as 55 below zero are occurring. Blowing snow will cause reduced visibilities to one half mile or less along highway summits. Plan on difficult travel conditions.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 08 at 1:55PM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow and cold wind chills as low as 50 below zero occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. In addition, areas of poor visibility are expected. * WHERE...Elliott Highway Summits.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 08 at 1:55PM AKST until February 09 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches are expected. Blowing snow will cause reduced visibilities to one half mile or less along highway summits. Plan on difficult travel conditions. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued February 08 at 3:30PM HST until February 09 at 6:00PM HST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... .A west northwest swell that will be arriving later today and through the overnight hours will elevate surf to advisory heights along northern and western exposed shores of the smaller islands. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST WEDNESDAY...
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala

entry.title: Extreme Fire Danger issued February 08 at 10:49AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: .DISCUSSION... Issued at 431 AM CST Tue Feb 8 2022 Very high to extreme fire weather conditions will overspread areas along and west of I-29 later this morning into the afternoon hours, with relative humidity values dropping down into the mid 20s to lower 30s.
